linkTarget.anchoringText: The field under study is located approximately 280 km south east, onshore Abu Dhabi, UAE. The first two wells were drilled in 1990s and tested with oil and water acquifer in different reservoirs. The land surrounding this field is generally categorized as flat terrain with sand plains and dunes, Figure 1.

Multiple completion can be defined as a well-equipped to produce oil or gas separately from more than one reservoir which includes, tubing-casing dual with a single tubing string and packer, dual tubing strings with a dual packer set up (Fig. 2), and triple completion which consists of three tubing strings (Fig. 3).

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Tubing- Casing Completion Dual Tubing Completion

formatted-caption.caption-text: Tubing- Casing Completion Dual Tubing Completion

linkTarget.anchoringText: In order to complete the required objectives, the well was designed as below (Figs. 4,5& 6):
Optimize the well departure from 2000 ft to 1100 ft, thus resulting in (Fig. 7):

Well-03 was completed with dual completion string, Figure 8, (2-7/8″ & 3-1/2″) in order to maximize the economic value of the well and to avail the chance of testing and producing two different reservoirs in same well at same time. The integrity of the well was really a challenge in this planned long term production and injection operation. In order to evaluate the well for its integrity, a stress check analysis was performed to ensure the forces applied on packer are within the limit of provided equipment pressure rating.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Dual Compleation Designe as optimised plan

formatted-caption.caption-text: Dual Compleation Designe as optimised plan

linkTarget.anchoringText: A 2-3 days short production and injection cycle was completed successfully. Gauges were recovered from both strings and data was down loaded and analyzed for quality check, noise level and any communication between strings, which revealed successful results, Figure 9.

Gauges were placed in both string s to evaluate the interference during the simultaneous production and injection period. There was a 22 hours period of production from the long string; the pressure profile in the short string was recorded at the same time during the injection and fall of period. There was no evidence found for interference or abnormal response in the pressure profile of the observation string, (Fig. 10).

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: Short term down -hole data of two strings

formatted-caption.caption-text: Short term down -hole data of two strings

linkTarget.anchoringText: The 22 hrs of production from the long string was followed by 4.5 hrs of pressure build up while injecting in the short string. There was no indication of interference observed in the downhole pressure data (Production + PBU) from the long string during the injection period trough the short string, Figure 11.

image-wrap.label: Figure 11
image-wrap.caption: Long string and short down- hole pressure data
